result.execSummary:
The defendant David L Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victims (person, property, residence or family) until Domestic Violence Training is complete, and then only non-violent contact with permission of agent and victims.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including psychological evaluation and Domestic Violence Training. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David L Nelson

defendant.name: Nelson, David L
defendant.address: 7711 S Loomis Road, Wind Lake, WI 53185

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to Defendant RE: Bond Monitoring

Attorney Wendy S. Paul in court.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Katie Giebel.
Ms. Paul indicates that the deft is having car trouble and cannot get here today  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Ct 1: 946.49(1)(b)-Felony BJ. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the victim TQN (person, property, residence or family).  No contact with Mother TN.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant David L Nelson in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Defendant David L Nelson in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State files amended information. Defense acknowledges receipt/waives reading of same; NG pleas entered. Upon plea to Cts 1 & 2 in 14CF1651, Ct 3 is DRI. The State recommends w/held sent - 2 yrs prob. Upon plea to charges in 15CF389 and 15CF728 State recommends 2 yrs WPS equal bifurdcation-STAYED. 2 yrs probation. If deft is revoked, WPS will be consecutive. cond; no contact, no alc/cs-UA's, FT emp, AODA assess, treatment as approp by agent, 6 mos RCJ.
P-NC to all
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant David L Nelson in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Defendant David L Nelson in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant David L Nelson in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Defendant David L Nelson in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
Defense requests adjournment. 
BTC: Adjournment granted.   Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the victim TQN (person, property, residence or family).  No contact with Mother TN.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant David L Nelson in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Defendant David L Nelson in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for Robert S Repischak for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
State asks for $10,000.00 cash in each of 15CF389 and 15CF728. Defense asks for reasonable cash bond.

BTC: Vacate warrant

          Bond to be set at $2000.00 cash on each of 15CF389 and 15CF728. All terms and conditions in 14CF1651 shall be incorporated into same.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Wendy S. Paul in court.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defendant is not present, defense has no explanation for his non appearance.

BTC: BW/BF in 15CF389 remains
Warrant forwarded to RCSO for entry.

Defendant David L Nelson not in court.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  No appearance, Bench/Arrest Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited.
